creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: nude men engaged in hand-to-hand combat, many with shields, arrows, clubs, daggers, etc.; men standing to fight in rear with others crouching and on ground in front row
inscription:
Stamp

in graphite on verso: 49.2.43/16 | B16 P25 | 22 | C11155 | 334
markings: brown stamp on verso, lower left: Cleveland Museum of Art (Lugt 449c); in graphite on stamp: dupl. / LSR / 25.57 / 6.12.80 / dupl.
provenance: P. & D. Colnaghi & Co., London; accessioned by Cleveland Museum of Art in 1957('), sold as duplicate on June 12, 1980; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Battle of Eighteen Nude Men
